svg:text.svg:tspan: I’ll say this once — and then I’ll probably repeat it several times — it is absolutely, completely, totally and
utterly essential that you make a plan before you start writing. Only a fool jumps right in without a plan...
To plan or not to plan, that is the question...
The answer is yes, yes, a thousand times yes. Often students dive right in, worried that planning will take up valuable
time. But 5 minutes spent organising a well-structured answer is loads better than pages of waffle. Mmm waffles.
1)If you plan, you’re less likely to forget something .
2)A good plan will help you your ideas — and write a good, essay.
3)Write your plan at the and draw a through it when you’ve finished.
4) spend on your plan. It’s only , so you don’t need to write in full sentences.
Here are a few of different ways you can plan your answer:
1) your essay will be much if you

It’s just to make sure you anything

1)Your should give a brief answer to the question you’re
writing about. Make it clear how you’re going to .

in detail and give evidence to back it up. Write a
for each point you make. Make sure you on your
evidence and it helps to your point.
3)Remember to write a — a paragraph at the end
